item.description: Application Mirror image (AMI) #aws #cloud #compute #packer AWS Provides a tool to recreate EC2 instances and install dependencies, applications, software and security updates, and configure customization quickly.
Auto Scaling Group (ASG) #aws #cloud #compute A service from AWS to spin up EC2 instances as well as remove them automatically according to the situation.

Bastion #aws #ec2 #cloud #compute also known as Jump-box Bastions are EC2 instances which are security harden. They are designed to help you gain access to your EC2 via SSH or RDP that are in private subnet which are not directly accessible from the internet.
Batch #aws #cloud #compute A batch workload solution by AWS similar to that of Azure Batch. To run scheduled computing job run only once in a certain period usually after the data has been collected.
Compute Optimizer #aws #cloud #compute An AWS service to recommend optimal AWS resources for your workloads to reduce costs and improve performance
EC2 #aws #cloud #compute The Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud, is an AWS platform for providing cloud-based compute capacity. That means it provides virtual machines in the sky.
Elastic Network Interface (ENI) #aws #cloud #compute #networking A basic network interface functionality provided by AWS to be attached to EC2.

Lambda #aws #cloud #serverless #compute #development Run code without provisioning or managing servers in AWS. Lambda executes your code only when needed and scales automatically to a few to a 1000 lambda functions concurrently in seconds.
AWS Lightsail #aws #cloud #compute A pre-configured managed instance solution provided by AWS designed to be low cost and ideal for users with less technical expertise similar to EC2.
Azure App Service #azure #cloud #compute It is a cloud computing based platform for hosting websites in Azure, created and operated by Microsoft.

Azure Virtual Desktop (AVD) #cloud #Azure #virtual-machines #compute Azure Virtual Desktop, (formerly known as Windows Virtual Desktop) is a Microsoft Azure-based system for virtualizing its Windows operating systems, aimed at enterprise customers rather than at individual users.
VM (Virtual Macines) #Azure #cloud #compute It is a simple compute service provided by Azure to host VMs in a VNET.
